channel.title: Noah Landis Github Site
channel.description: Recent content on Noah Landis Github Site

item.title: Worth a Shot? NFL QBs and the Covid Vaccine
item.description: During the course of the 2021 NFL season one of the biggest topics of debate was surrounding the vaccination status of players. With strict guidelines and protocols put in place by the NFL many players opted to receive the shot. However, not every player ended up getting the vaccine. Some notable unvaccinated players include Aaron Rodgers, Lamar Jackson, Deandre Hopkins, Adam Thielen and Joe Mixon. Many people tend to agree that Quarterback is the most important position on a football team.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About Noah Landis
item.description: Hello my name is Noah Landis.I am a junior student at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln pursuing a bachelors degree in Journalism with a major in Sports Media and Communications. Additionally, I am working towards obtaining a minor in Entrepreneurship. My expected graduation is in May 2023. I am interested in jobs involving production, social media and possibly even marketing.
